description: From Middle English reklesnes, reklesnesse, rekelesnesse (also assibiliated as rechelesnes, reccheleesnesse), from Old English rēcelēasnes (“recklessness, carelessness, negligence”), equivalent to reckless +‎ -ness.

entries.meaning: The state or quality of being reckless or heedless, of taking unnecessary risks.
examples: His recklessness repeatedly put him in danger.
